Description: Rim and body sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style pottery plate; very worn white slip; interior: narrow vertical bars on grooved projecting rim; narrow black band at edge of floor, then key maeander frieze; central area worn, but black band clear; exterior: band on edge and underside of rim, with two, perhaps three bands on wall.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For similar rims, see British Museum 1886,0401.1019 and 1888,0601.544g.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.706)
